full_text:
1
IN THE COURT OF THE SESSIONS JUDGE,
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
PRESENT : SMT. NAZEERA.S, SESSIONS JUDGE
On Wednesday, 5" day of March 2025/14" day of Phalguna, 1946.
Criminal M.C.No. 647/2025
Crime No. 99/2025 of Kazhakkuttam Police Station pending before the Judicial
First Class Magistrate Court -II Attingal
Petitioners/Accused_Nos. 1 and 2 :-
1. Thankuttan residing at
Thiruvathira Bhavan Thrippadapuram
Kulathoor P.O Thiruvananthapuram
2. Vishnu residing at Thiruvathira Bhavan
Thrippadapuram Kulathoor P.O
Thiruvananthapuram
By Advocates:- M Anil Prasad
Counter Petitioners :-
1) Station House Officer
Kazhakuttom Police Station
2) State of Kerala
By Public Prosecutor Dr. T. Geenakumari
This Criminal M.C. is coming on for hearing on 04.03.2025 and the court
on 05.03.2025 passed the following :
ORDER
This is an application filed by accused Nos. 1 and 2 in the above crime
under Section 483 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, seeking regular
bail.

2

2. The petitioners/ accused Nos. 1 and 2 are alleged to have
committed the offences punishable under Sections 296(b), 115(2), 118(1) and
109(1), r/w Section 3(5) of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

3. The prosecution allegation in brief is as follows:- The 3" accused
and the defcto complainant are husband and wife. The friend of the defacto
complainant sent some private photos and videos of the 3" accused, while she
was abroad, to the defacto complainant, which he forwarded to the wife of the
2° accused, and thereafter, the defacto complainant filed a divorce petition
against the 3 accused. Due to that animosity, on 19.01.2025 at about 11.15
p.m., the 3 accused called the defacto complainant over phone to come to a
place near the Library at Thrippadapuram Temple, and when the defacto
complainant reached there, the 3 accused quarreled with him, and at that time,
the 2"! accused slapped on the left cheek of the defacto complainant, and the 1*
accused abused and threatened him, and by using a chopper, hacked him on his
left hip, causing an injury, and the 2" accused exhorted to kill him. Thereafter,
accused Nos. 2 and 3 restrained the defacto complainant and the 1* accused
hacked him above the left hip, causing a deep injury.

4. Reportedly, the 1* petitioner / 1 accused was arrested on
27.01.2025 and the 2™ petitioner / 2" accused was arrested on 20.01.2025 and
they are in judicial custody since then.

3

5. Notice in this bail application is issued to the Public Prosecutor.
The Investigating Officer filed report opposing the bail application.

6. Heard. Perused the records.

7. The only point to be considered is, whether regular bail can be
granted to the petitioners/ accused Nos. 1 and 2.

8. The Point:- The 1" petitioner / 1" accused is the father of the 2"
petitioner / 2™ accused and the 3 accused. Allegedly, accused Nos. 1 and 2 had
assaulted the defacto complainant, and the 1* accused had stabbed him, using a
chopper. The marital problems between the defacto complainant and the 3"
accused is the motive of the alleged assault.

9. According to the petitioners, they are absolutely innocent of the
allegations levelled against them and they were arrayed as accused on the basis
of the allegations of the defacto complainant, solely to wreck vengeance against
the petitioners due to personal and matrimonial disputes. It is submitted that,
the 1* petitioner is the father-in-law and the 2™ petitioner is the brother-in-law
of the defacto complainant, and the 3 accused is the legally wedded wife of the
defacto complainant, and when she questioned the illicit relationship of the
defacto complainant with other women, their relationship got strained, and the
defacto complainant demanded divorce from the 3” accused. It is also
submitted that, thereafter, the defacto complainant used to visit her home and

4
started threatening her after consuming alcohol, and none of the accused met
the defacto complainant on the alleged date of incident.

10. The magnitude of the offence alleged is grave. Apparently, there is
marital dispute between the 3" accused and the defacto complainant. It is seen
from the First Information Statement given by the defacto complainant that both
of them were living separately for the past three years and that a mutual divorce
petition is pending before the court. Going by the First Information Statement, it
is seen that the 3" accused had called over phone the defacto complainant and
asked him to come to a place to talk something and when he reached the said
place, the petitioners/accused Nos. 1 and 2 also came to the spot and there was
some altercation between the two, and consequently, the alleged assault
occurred. It is stated that the defacto complainant had sustained deep injuries
and he was taken to Medical College Hospital. The discharge summary of the
defacto complainant/victim appended along with the report shows that, he had
sustained severe injuries, including fracture to rib, incised wound over left
lumbar region, and incised wound over left flank. So there are corresponding
injuries. It is stated in the report that the chopper used for the commission of
the offence was recovered. So, the prosecution has made out a prima facie case
against the petitioners and regarding the involvement of the petitioners in the
alleged offence. The investigation in this case is progressing. The 1“ petitioner
/ 1" accused is in custody only for a period of 37 days and the 2" petitioner / 2"

5
accused is in custody only for a period of 44 days. It is stated in the report that,
the 1* petitioner is involved in eight other crimes and the 2" petitioner is
involved in two other crimes. So the criminal antecedents of the petitioners is
noted. It is stated in the report that, the 3% accused is yet to be arrested and her
mobile phone is to be recovered. So, if the petitioners are released on bail, it
may hinder the arrest of the 3" accused, and they are likely to influence or
intimidate the defacto complainant and other witnesses and tamper with the
evidence. So, the investigation will be adversely affected. The chance of
absconding also cannot be ruled out. Considering the afore aspects, including
the gravity of the offence, this court is not inclined to release the petitioners on
bail at this stage.
In the result, this petition is dismissed.
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by him, corrected and
pronounced by me in Open Court on this the 5" day of March, 2025.
NAZEERA S.
SESSIONS JUDGE
